title: ERAs of EXCELLENCE
body_text:
Every major era in ECD's colorful history has witnessed the emergence of two imposing forces that stand out from their warrior peers.
The original Ocean Road Park run featured its most brutal collision when Chris Adams fought John Tronolone. During the
Dark Days
, the historic C. Adams-Fitzpatrick rivalry set new standards of competition and altered behind-the-scenes designs. As time went on, the dominating couples - Butler/Bertsch & Krott/Kerr - waged war in an ECD first while K. Adams and Tronolone contested for the crown at the first centennial. And in more recent times, titans K. Adams and Fitzpatrick mightily clashed on the road to 200.
So it's no secret that a pair of individuals have undoubtedly remained at the top of the pecking order even before the advent of this "reunion" phase. After more than a decade of dedication and sacrifice, it's finally going to happen:
These iconic queens are the last of a dying breed as evident by their continued rise in star power, admirable physical improvements, and collapse of their female counterparts.
body_html:
Every major era in ECD's colorful history has witnessed the emergence of two imposing forces that stand out from their warrior peers.

The original Ocean Road Park run featured its most brutal collision when Chris Adams fought John Tronolone. During the Dark Days, the historic C. Adams-Fitzpatrick rivalry set new standards of competition and altered behind-the-scenes designs. As time went on, the dominating couples - Butler/Bertsch & Krott/Kerr - waged war in an ECD first while K. Adams and Tronolone contested for the crown at the first centennial. And in more recent times, titans K. Adams and Fitzpatrick mightily clashed on the road to 200.

So it's no secret that a pair of individuals have undoubtedly remained at the top of the pecking order even before the advent of this "reunion" phase. After more than a decade of dedication and sacrifice, it's finally going to happen:


These iconic queens are the last of a dying breed as evident by their continued rise in star power, admirable physical improvements, and collapse of their female counterparts.
